name: Kepler-257
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-257 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-257 is a star with 1.0070000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.04 times its radius. It is located 2601.91 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-257 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-257 b

Kepler-257 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.38 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-257.

The mass of Kepler-257 b is 9.63 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-257 b is 2.61 that of Earth. At 9.63 Earth masses, Kepler-257 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-257 c

Kepler-257 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.58 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-257.

The mass of Kepler-257 c is 55.42 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-257 c is 5.41 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-257 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-257 d

Kepler-257 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 24.66 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-257.

The mass of Kepler-257 d is 44.79 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-257 d is 4.95 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-257 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-257, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
